meanings.definition: The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.
meanings.sent1: My homeplace is a cozy house with a big garden.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, coming back to my homeplace is the best feeling.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally locked myself out of my homeplace and had to climb through a window!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the warm embrace of a homeplace in a world of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree in the backyard of my homeplace has witnessed generations of my family.

meanings.definition: A place where one feels comfortable and at ease.
meanings.sent1: The library is my homeplace where I can relax and read in peace.
meanings.sent2: For her, the beach was the ultimate homeplace to unwind and recharge.
meanings.sent3: His car, filled with snacks and music, became his mobile homeplace during road trips.
meanings.sent4: In her paintings, she captured the essence of a dreamy homeplace by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cafe with its friendly staff felt like a second homeplace to many regular customers.
